means: 逼真，逼真的事物，貌似真实

sentence.Network_en: At the required level of visual verisimilitude, computer animation is costly.
sentence.Network_cn: 要使电脑动画的视觉效果达到要求的逼真程度，花费会十分昂贵。

sentence.Network_en: To add verisimilitude, the stage is covered with sand for the desert scenes.
sentence.Network_cn: 为了更加逼真，舞台上铺满了沙子作为沙漠的场景。

sentence.Network_en: His theory on verisimilitude is a theory on the end of science.
sentence.Network_cn: 逼真性的理论是他关于科学的目的的理论.

PerfectNetExp.abs: ...approximate truth)，近似真理有时也被说成“似真性”(plausibility)或“逼真”(verisimilitude)；而且，实在论者的真理观大都是“真理符合论”或曰“真理对应论”(correspondence the.
正像早期的波普尔认为，哲学家应该比较相互竞争的理论的内容，评价其“逼真性”（verisimilitude）一样，后期的波普尔认为，哲学家应该检验在动物王国中发现的认知结构的整个系列以使比较生物系统与环境之间.
verify 证实verisimilitude 真实性verity 真实性
verify 确定verisimilitude 逼真；貌似真实veristron 自旋量子放大器

list.abs: These flower illustrationsshow the artist ' s concern for verisimilitude ., 这些花卉插图表明这个画家很注重写实.
merely corroborative detail , intended to give artistic verisimilitude to an otherwise bald and unconvincing narrative ( W.S.Gilbert.试图赋予一原本枯燥而不可信的叙述以艺术真实性的区区确定性细节吉尔伯特)

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from Latin verisimilitudo, from verisimilis 'probable', from veri (genitive of verus 'true') + similis 'like'

entry.def: Verisimilitude is the quality of seeming to be true or real.

example.ex: At the required level of visual verisimilitude, computer animation is costly.
example.tran: 要使电脑动画的视觉效果达到要求的逼真程度，花费会十分昂贵。

means.word_mean: 1. the appearance of truth; the quality of seeming to be true

auth_sentence.content: They got a little jumpy at the big-house verisimilitude.
auth_sentence.res_content: They got a little jumpy at the big-house verisimilitude.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They got a little jumpy at the big-house verisimilitude.

auth_sentence.content: It confuses the depiction of strength with the energy of verisimilitude.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: It confuses the depiction of strength with the energy of verisimilitude.

auth_sentence.content: A born journalist who made...use of the experience of others...to lend verisimilitude to his books.
